intro: Genista lasiocarpa, commonly known as the hairy broom, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, spiny stems and small, yellow, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, leathery pods that contain several seeds. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Genista lasiocarpa is often used in landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
